definitions.text: a mechanical or electrical explosive device or a small amount of explosive; can be used to initiate the reaction of a disrupting explosive
something serving as a cover or protection
a fruiting structure resembling an umbrella or a cone that forms the top of a stalked fleshy fungus such as a mushroom
a protective covering that is part of a plant
an upper limit on what is allowed
examples: he put a ceiling on the number of women who worked for him
there was a roof on salaries
they established a cap for prices

definitions.text: (dentistry) dental appliance consisting of an artificial crown for a broken or decayed tooth
examples: tomorrow my dentist will fit me for a crown

definitions.text: the upper part of a column that supports the entablature
restrict the number or amount of
examples: We had to cap the number of people we can accept into our club
